definition: the four arts (zither, Go, calligraphy, painting)/the accomplishments of a well-educated person
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither
chess/chess-like game/a game of chess/CL:盤|盘[pan2]/chess piece/CL:個|个[ge4],顆|颗[ke1]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: Woman is the daughter of rich family, literature, everything terrible.
sentences.chinese: 女人是大户人家的女儿，琴棋书画样样了得。

sentences.english: Poetry and painting everything through, but not refined.
sentences.chinese: 琴棋书画样样通，但不精。

sentences.english: Poetry and painting, painting also came in last.
sentences.chinese: 琴棋书画，画也排在最后。

sentences.english: House of quaint Chinese literature, of course, can not do without these elements. In Mr.
sentences.chinese: 古雅的中式之家当然不能没有琴棋书画这些元素。

definition: the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
poetry and pictorial art/work of art combining pictures and poetry
well versed in letters and military technology (idiom); fine scholar and soldier/master of pen and sword
girl from a wealthy family/unmarried daughter of a noble house
